search.slidetext: start course start course start course start course start course start course van operation fleet services

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% download the course companion to follow along download the course companion to follow along uc davis van operation 3 2 driving a passenger van 1 uc davis van operation this module is approximately 20 minutes long safety inspection driving tips
taller longer %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
15-passenger van available through commercial rental vendors %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% view the uc policy not available through campus class b license required

look for loose parts & leaking fluids inspect the vehicle before every trip fluid levels engine oil power steering coolant transmission fluid hoses cables check the condition & pressure of all tires check the interior gauges, lights & switches adjust your seat & clear loose items %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% adjust the steering wheel so it is pointing at your chest, not your face all interior & exterior lights are functional
become familiar with the vehicle’s blindspots %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% national highway traffic safety administration always slow down when turning

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect false. the university requires a commercial driver’s license class b in order for operators of 15 passenger vans on official campus business. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue true true true true true true false false false false false false test your knowledge click the submit button the university does not require any special type of driver’s license for operators of 15 passenger vans on official campus business. %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
next next next next next next center of gravity center of gravity center of gravity center of gravity center of gravity center of gravity %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
contact fleet services for approval %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% plan your routes ahead of time minimize left turns less time idling minimize exposure when turning across opposing traffic lanes

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns, avoid carrying rooftop luggage, and if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% test your knowledge when driving a van, you should…please select the correct statements. plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns plan your routes ahead of time to minimize left turns avoid carrying rooftop luggage avoid carrying rooftop luggage avoid carrying rooftop luggage avoid carrying rooftop luggage avoid carrying rooftop luggage avoid carrying rooftop luggage if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections if left turns are necessary, use controlled intersections take as many passengers as possible take as many passengers as possible take as many passengers as possible take as many passengers as possible take as many passengers as possible take as many passengers as possible click the submit button
beware of the wind %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
vans are heavier than passenger cars %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
4-second following distance increase your distance as the distance between cars increase reduce your speed/distance if road condition is not ideal %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
use the cover the brake technique %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect you should never carry more passengers than the number of seatbelts. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% test your knowledge when exiting a tunnel, be extra careful because... sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle sudden blasts of wind can make you loose control of your vehicle it may be too bright it may be too bright it may be too bright it may be too bright it may be too bright it may be too bright the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel the police may be waiting for you at the end of the tunnel it may be raining it may be raining it may be raining it may be raining it may be raining it may be raining click the submit button
avoid clusters %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
avoid the pack %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%

backing up passenger vans can be challenging avoid backing whenever possible recruit a helper to guide you arrange hand signals ahead of time position the helper to the side of the van check for pedestrians in the surrounding areas %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% watch for obstacles around campus

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% never exceed the maximum number of passengers/seat belts danger of rolling over load heaviest cargo near to the floor & center of the vehicle weigh your vehicle at a public scale use a limit bar to prevent load shift inspect the vehicle before every trip visit the fmcsa website secure animals in travel cage check the gvw in the owner’s manual visit the dmv website inspect cargo load restraints regularly
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% hazardous materials requires placards on the vehicle visit the fmcsa website
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% use caution when loading & unloading passengers
%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% stay alert while driving don’t hesitate too switch drivers chat with passengers to keep alertness less likely to getting involved in a crash

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect false. the statement on the question is correct. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue true true true true true true false false false false false false %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% test your knowledge click the submit button adding too many passengers raises the center of gravity in the van, which greatly increases the likelihood of rollover during otherwise minor accidents.

%project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% avoid use of electronic devices while driving become familiar with the policy most states ban the use of handheld devices while driving remain focused while driving refrain from eating while driving
thank you for watching! %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides% visit nhtsa.gov

facilities.ucdavis.edu/fleetservices facilities.ucdavis.edu/fleetservices contact us fleetservices@ucdavis.edu fleetservices@ucdavis.edu 530-752-1199 530-752-1199 fleet services %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
exit course exit course exit course restart course restart course restart course congratulations, you’ve completed this course. fleet services %project.slidenumber%|%project.totalslides%
